meanings.definition: A colorless, flammable gas used as a fuel.
meanings.sent1: The ethanes in the tank are ready to power the generator.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic refilled the engine with ethanes to keep it running smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The ethanes in the canister were so eager to burn, they almost jumped out!
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the ethanes was like a flame that never flickered.
meanings.sent5: The smell of ethanes lingered in the air, a reminder of its power.

meanings.definition: A class of organic compounds containing two carbon atoms joined by a single bond.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the structure of ethanes to understand their properties better.
meanings.sent2: Organic chemistry textbooks often explain the properties of ethanes in detail.
meanings.sent3: The ethanes in the lab were known for their strong bond, always sticking together.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two carbon atoms in ethanes was as solid as a rock.
meanings.sent5: In the world of organic compounds, ethanes stand out for their simplicity.
